intro: Rollinia chrysocarpa, commonly known as the golden fruit tree, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Myristicaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, yellow-orange fruits that are edible and have a sweet, tangy flavor. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value as well as its fruit. Rollinia chrysocarpa is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and birds.
